meanings.definition: To place or fix in position for use or service
meanings.sent1: I will install the new light bulb in the lamp.
meanings.sent2: The technician will install the software on my computer.
meanings.sent3: I tried to install the square peg in the round hole, but it didn't fit.
meanings.sent4: She decided to install a sense of calm in her mind before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic will install the new engine in the car tomorrow.

meanings.definition: To establish in an office, position, or place
meanings.sent1: The company will install a new manager in the department next week.
meanings.sent2: They plan to install security cameras around the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to install itself as the ruler of the house, much to the dog's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness was installed in the community, leading to positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The king decided to install his loyal advisor as the new chancellor.

meanings.definition: To set up for use or service
meanings.sent1: I need to install the tent before we can start camping.
meanings.sent2: The IT team will install the new network system in the office.
meanings.sent3: He tried to install a sense of humor in his robot creation, but it didn't quite work.
meanings.sent4: She decided to install a new routine in her daily life for better productivity.
meanings.sent5: The chef will install a new menu in the restaurant next month.
